Posts.Content: I had invasive infiltrating lobular carcinoma and lymph node. Did ac/t which is adriamycin/cytoxan and then taxol before double mastectomy. Was expecting a lumpectomy  and the margins also were clear but doctors said the best was a mastectomy. Even though the cancer was only in one breast I would not go thru the surgery twice so I elected for a double.  Had reconstruction right away and had a small rash on my chest which was missed by all the doctors and turned out to be cancer. Get more than one opinion, which I had done. Sorry you had to join the club.
Posts.Title: Experiences with breast surgery and chemo options

Posts.Content: Kathy, Before you sign up ask for the informed consent to participate in research papers. I was all ready to start a clinical trial myself until I found out what the side effects would  be. The side effects are worse than what I have now and am trying to avoid. I am stage 4. Find out the pros and cons. Sue
Posts.Title: The Tailorx Clinical Trial

Posts.Content: Jodie, Thanks for answering me. I have been on this board in the past and never got anywhere.  The taxol was the worst for me out of all the chemos. My friend said it was a breeze for her but my first one took 6 hours because the pain in my back was awful so they had to keep slowing it down. You lose eyebrows, lashes and all other hair except my head started to grow back, still have tiny eyelashes and I finished taxol 2-28-07. Told doctors I would rather do the a/c over again. Taxol also cause neuropathy in your feet and hands. My big toe turned black and pus came out the nail one day which was gross. Yes you want to keep lots of cream on your feet. I still use it every morning and night. Also got sores on my toes. Took several months to go away BUT it did go away. Now xeloda made be mean. First time the doctors had that side effect but I am different. Xeloda did not work for me and I tried it twice. If this gemzar doesn't work the only thing left is xeloda and some thing else I can't remember what the doctor said. My doctor can not understand why the herceptin isn't working cause they always get great results with it.  When I first started I was triple negative and then when it came back my her2/neu changed to 3+ which is unheard  almost. My cancer is met to my tissue. Only other woman doctor had with same cancer is dead. Have not been able to find anyone else with it. By the way I did change doctors from the first cancer till now. Hope this helps some. Please keep in touch. Walking inyour foot prints. Sue
Posts.Title: herceptin isnt working!

Posts.Content: Hi.Get a 2nd and 3rd!!!! I had chemo, bilateral mastectomy, and lymph nodes removed, then reconstruction. Was told no need for radiation. Was 111A now 4. They missed the cancer when it was back during reconstruction. Also have your hormones rechecked and not from the first test, make them take a new sample. Had 4 take over the course of mine (started 10/06) and got 3 triple neg and 1 pos her2 so they do make mistakes.  A few weeks is not going to make that much difference. See other doctors please. sue
Posts.Title: mastectomy or not

Posts.Content: Know how you feel. I had stage 3 breast cancer. Had adriamycin, cytoxan and then taxol. Surgery. Then was told I was all better. Had a rash during treatment and asked if it could be cancer and was told no. After 6 months of different creams (it was only the size of a pea) went and had it tested and now stage 4 and incurable but treatable. Have tried xeloda, avastin, herceptin, navelbine and now gemzar. Herceptin was also along with some of the other meds and it is not working. Will be two years next month. If we find something that is working I will let you know.  The only way to get through the day is to enjoy it and laugh. I find it harder to get another day under my belt if I focus on why me. Hope something kicks in. God Bless Sue
Posts.Title: herceptin isnt working!

Posts.Content: Hi Everyone, My name is Sue and I have stage 4 breast cancer. I have done the chemo and surgery and more chemo. Now have gone on to alternative treatments. Does anyone know the effect of alkalized wate or distilled with pH drops? Thank you and God Bless
Posts.Title: alkalized water

Posts.Content: HI.Had reconstruction and NO nipples. No one other than who you choose to  let see you body matters, and they won't care.Tattoos fade. My explanders moved and then when I had them replaced the doctor put them in the wrong place and I had to redo them. It was in2007 and I am still in pain. If I could do it over again I would not of had them put it. Can not take them out because the cancer is still on my chest and my skin will not heal.........................I would pass...................Sue
Posts.Title: Nipple reconstruction...to do..or not to do???

Posts.Content: Patti,   I forgot to tell you that you have to stay away from folic acid. I didn't in the beginning and my cheeks feel like they fall asleep even to this day and it has been months.   After the gemzar and herceptin I am taking now my doctor wants me to try xeloda and tykerb. Last chemo left to try but for now I will stay on the IV stuff.   God Bless Sue
Posts.Title: Help-has anyone taken Xoelda

Posts.Content: The only lump I have under my armpit is my lymph node and yes it is cancer. I am stage four now and wish to do no more surgery. Already had some taken out and was told cancer free. If you have it tested ask for left axillary lymph node test. Your lymph hodes are small, bean-shaped structures that are part of the immune system and store special cells that can trap cancer cells or bacteria traveling through the body. Been on different chemos for the last two years without a break and the node changes in size with the treatments. I would ask to have it tested. Best of luck .Sue
Posts.Title: Lump on armpit

Posts.Content: Hi. I have been on xeloda twice and will have to go back on it in the future. Yes I did get the feet sores and my hands could not go in hot water for awhile so my poor husband had to do the dishes. Get some B complex vitamins and take a dropper everyday this helps with the hand and foot problems. All chemos make you tired. Other than that xeloda is not bad. Best of luck.  Sue
Posts.Title: Help-has anyone taken Xoelda

Posts.Content: Doctor wants to start me on 5-FU with advastin next week. Any one else try this combination before and if so what can I expect.   Thanks Sue
Posts.Title: 5-FU

Posts.Content: Hi! I was surprised no one did respond.  Along with the 5-fu, avastin they also are giving me mitoxantrone (novantrone) and Leucovorin calcium. The first treatment went from 10-3, the next two days were 2 hours at that was without the avastin and mitoxantrone. You will pee a real pretty BLUE, also felt sick to my stomach but never got sick.........ate crackers for 3 days. Have sores in my throat and tongue....oh make sure before they give you the 5-fu push that they also give you ice to protect your throat. They forgot on day 2 so that is why I am having sores. Felt pretty bad for a week but I still went to work every day except for the 10-3 day. I deliver mail so my job is hard work. Go back on the 17/18/19 for my next treatment.  Let me know how yours go please. Sue
Posts.Title: 5-FU

Posts.Content: Miss Penny,  Hope your treatment went well. Have to say the first week was awful but finally some thing is working and I am looking forward to my next treatments on the 17,18,19. Please let me know how you are doing. Sue
Posts.Title: 5-FU

Posts.Content: Hi Angel Bear, I also had a double in 2007 with lymph nodes cancer. Skipped radiation because it was not in my chest wall. The AC/T chemo did not kill all the cancer cause it only takes one cell to hide and my cancer never went away even though we thought it had. Now it is to late for radiation. I would if I could now but I can't. Take the radiation please. You will be surprised on how fast you forget how bad it is and now and WILL live a good long live. Go for it. Sue
Posts.Title: 2nd masectomy, 2weeks ago

Posts.Content: HI Carol, I was diagnosed in 10/06, started treatment in 11/06. Lost work for 10 months because I work for the post office and if you are not 100% you can not work. I did have a private disability insurance because the post office has none and social security refused me because cancer is NOT a disability. Still am under a lot of debt but you can not get blood out of a stone. I made the mistake the first go round by putting everything on credit cards. Now I make payments monthly and nothing goes on the credit card. The plastic surgeon is going after me for non payment but he screwed up so he will be the last one to be paid. My story in short form. Found a lump on my upper left side that would come and go. Went and had a diagnostic mamogram and ultra sound and it still did not show up. When the doctor asked me to move my arm it shot up and he sent me straight to a surgeon. Had invasive infiltrating lobular carcinoma along with lymph nodes. Went and had ac/t chemo, then double mastectomy and reconstruction. Stage 3A. Wow your cancer is gone. Had a rash during reconstruction and it turned out to be cancer which I even asked the doctors if it could be cancer and was told no. When I had my expanders in they had shifted and when they put my implants in they put the left one in the wrong place. Plastic surgeon came in and said that is not where I wanted them come back in 6 weeks and we will re-do. I was back in for re-do in two weeks cause I needed to get back to work. I have been in pain since then and that was 7-11-7 so you can understand why he will be paid last. Then in 10/07 I went to a dermatologist to have the rash checked out and told him at least we knew it was not cancer. Wrong...now I am stage 4 with metastatic adenocarcinoma. My cancer is on the outside of my body so we can see if it gets better or not. Have new wonderful oncologist and have been on lots of chemos since 11/07. Hanging in there but getting tired. Sorry for the long short story. Every day I say......Lord, keep your arm around my shoulder and your hand over my mouth. Sue
Posts.Title: Hi I am Carol

Posts.Content: HI Carol,  Hats off to you for working. When I did taxol it knocked me on my butt. Was ok with the a/c but taxol made every part of  my body hurt. I did have to take shots for the blood the day after each chemo - neulasta- and that also causes joint pain. The mind does go but it does come back. I am triple negative, stage 4. I even tried herceptin even though I am her2  negative. Had no bad side effects from the herceptin other than it did not work. As far as feeling old ......well that does seem to happen. I am 58 going on 110.........BUT I still look 80 something. Carol you sound like a very strong person (working long hours) you will do well. God Bless Sue
Posts.Title: Hi I am Carol

Posts.Content: Thanks Tre, Yes I did see an opthamalogist. The drusen are not in the macular degeneration area but I do have some signs of the degeneration. I have forward the doctors information to my oncologist and have finished my last treatment of chemos. Thanks Sue
Posts.Title: drusen

Posts.Content: I now have drusen. I did some reading about the potential for developing retinal drusen in association with chemotherapies. Turns out that it is a concern with some drugs, and that usually the oncologist will recommend that you make periodic visits to an ophthalmologist during the course of treatment. With certain drusen formations there is some risk of retinal detachment, which can be sight threatening. Has anyone else developed drusen. Thanks Sue
Posts.Title: drusen

Posts.Content: May,   What did doctor number 2 say? Always, Always get more than one opinion. Do NOT sit on the fence. Sue
Posts.Title: Micro-calcifications

Posts.Content: Noel, No it is not good when the doctor wants to see you in person. When mine came back the second time the doctor called me but he did tell me over the phone. Have you looked up imflammatory breast cancer? Sounds like that MIGHT be what you have. Let me know the out come. Oh by the way the long wait between visits are normal..........they have too many people to see.......I was told that I was not the only one at one point....I couldn't understand why I had to wait so long in between.  The It made sense. Your neighbor is a piece of work. No jumping on the floor and slamming doors is not a good example for your son but it sure must of felt good. Will your landlord help with the moving expenses? Are you working? I deliver the mail 6 days a week and it is killing me. Chemo and the hot weather do not mix well, but if I don't work I would not have insurance. Matter a fact all my treatments and meds are now free for the rest of the year..........that means I have met my out of pocket already of $5000.00...no wonder I am always worrying about money but some how it does show up and worrying is not going to make it happen. I have my fingers crossed that you just have a really bad infection and nothing else. Let me know. Thinking of you, Sue
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer signs and symptoms

Posts.Content: Noel, You have every right to be concerned. This might sound crazy but go to a dermatologist. When my cancer came back I was under the care of a oncologist and she said it was not cancer. My primary doctor sent me to a dermatologist who sent me to a surgeon and yes it was cancer again. You might want to check out imflamatory breast cancer.  I kind of look like that but my new oncologist says no.  That is not what I have but my cancer is now on the outside of my chest wall. I have already had a bilateral mastectomy so I thought I would be done with cancer but that is not the way it plays. You will find the strength in yourself to deal with what ever is instore for you. You have a child that needs his Mom and that alone will help you. Plus you reached out to others and they will always be there for you. Call a dermatologist today if you can and tell them you can't wait. God Bless Sue
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer signs and symptoms

Posts.Content: Noel Hi. I am from Binghamton, NY...left in 1972 , been in Florida almost the whole time. If your landlord wants to move you than I would let him since you say where you are is bad. I am 59 and have been fighting bc since 10/06. I am stage 4 which means treatable but not cureable. Lost my hair, had bilateral mastectomy even though only cancer in one, lymph nodes removed, and then reconstruction. Even after all that my cancer came back in months. Have been on chemos since 11/07 with new doctor. When I had the first go round I went to Shands Breast Center which should of been the best but things happen. Cancer does not run in my family. I just got in the wrong line. Since I was told I had it I NEVER once thought I was going to die and that is probably why I am here today. Things could be much worse. You could have MS or no use of your limbs. I realize that you are going thru some tough times now and more than likely some more. You need to think about good things and not think about what may be. You MUST change your attitude. Life is good, be strong. Go take a long shower and cry your eyes out than play with your son. I will be here for you!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Sue
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer signs and symptoms

Posts.Content: Noel, You are not alone about breast cancer. I never even knew that there was more than one until I found out I had it. I can not tell you if you should or should not go ahead with having them removed. Myself I had them test the lump and the axillary lymph node. When they came back cancer I had chemo first. If they removed the lump first then they told me they have no way of knowing if it shrunk or not and that made sense. The wait and see part is hard. Your mind will think of nothing else but the worrying is NOT going to change the out come so don't let it run you. Try and smile as much as possible....it helps. When I went to the doctors they could not find my lump thru mamo or the ultra sound. It showed up when I moved my arm. It was 5cm. I knew I had the lump cause it would come and go so I thought since it was not attached to the bone it would be fine, but again I was wrong. Take one day at a time. That is all we all get sick or not. Let me know how it goes. I live in Florida, how about you. God Bless Sue
Posts.Title: Breast Cancer signs and symptoms

Posts.Content: Yes it is hard on the mind. I myself have had a double. Try and make sure you have button down clothing to wear afterwards. I even bought a dress 3x larger than my size to come home in. Try and think about some of the things that will be hard to do at home before Tuesday. Also start to move around within a week like walking the wall so you will heal faster. Will be thinking of you on Tuesday.
Posts.Title: Masectomy

Posts.Content: Hi, Had my surgery on April 19,2007. Bilaterol mastectomy and three nodes taken out. Still have pain and was told by one of the doctors that it would last aroung two years. Have the cord feeling also and will ask my doctor on the 20th if he knows what it is. Use udderly smooth udder cream which you can get in drugstores and massage under your arm morning and night. Ask a third doctor what they think it is. My cancer came back as a rash while I was still being treated the first time and I asked the onc. if it could be cancer and she missed it. Ask Ask Ask. Doctors just practice. Walking in your footprints. Sue
Posts.Title: Pain 10 months after having lymph nodes removed

Posts.Content: By all means do the chamber. When I lived in south Florida I had customers come down to use the chamber from up north and they swear by it. They had the money to be able to do it. I don"t or I would.
Posts.Title: ?Would hyperbaria help riadiated tissue from bc so I can have a mastectomy.

Posts.Content: Tried the blog but says does not exist. I also am tn. Try the website tnbcfoundation.org..............It is kinda hard to get around on though. If you would like to talk I would be more than happy too. --Message edited by CancerCompass staff. For personal protection, email address removed. Consider private reply. Please review CancerCompass Member Guidelines at http://www.cancercompass.com/common/guidelines.html--  Sue
Posts.Title: Triple Negative Chemo Blog

Posts.Content: On 12/19/2008 will be ok2 wrote: I am a 35 year old who just had a double mastectomy with immediate reconstruction.  I have also completed half of my "dose dense" chemo which so far consisted of Adriamyacin and Cytoxin (4 rounds).  I am now about to begin 4 rounds of the Taxol drugs at four and a half hour sessions every 2 weeks.  I have been told I have tolerated the first rounds of "AC" pretty well and those are usually the hardest to get through. ( I personally don't think it's been so easy ).  My doctor has said that some people who went smoothly through the AC's have a tough time with Taxol.   I have since been reading about Taxol and the pain, pre-treatment drugs and other rumors have scared me a bit.  Has anyone else out there had any experiences with taking the same drugs as me that can offer some advice for getting through the Taxol treatments. Thanks.   Andi Andi,   Hi.  I also had A/C with little problems other than being tired all the time. Taxol was very hard on me. My first treatment took over 6 hours because of the back pain. The other 3 gave me muscle and joint pain and took every ounce of energy I had. I was 57 at the time and my friend was 38 when she did the same AC/T. She had a hard time with AC but said Taxol was a breeze. It will just depends on how your body responds. Will be thinking of you. Sue
Posts.Title: Fear of Taxol

Posts.Content: Yes I am also taking gemzar and herceptin now. Gemzar for the last 21/2 months and herceptin for 6 months. I started out in 10/06 with triple negative stage 3a and when the cancer came back after all the treatments and surgery my her2 changed to 3+ and am now stage 4. Today I am going to have another sample taken and retested because I am not responding to anything. The only side effects I have.... is being whipped after treatment and my hair is thinning. Of course I have the hand and foot syndome from past treatments of other things but B complex helps with that. No bloating.  My LAST treatment is tykerb and xeloda (do not like) they want to try, not sure I want to go that way yet.   You have to remember with or without cancer you only get one day at a time.............live life and enjoy.......best of luck...my prayers are with you.Sue
Posts.Title: Herp2-/erpr- Gemzar

Posts.Content: Has anyone ever had the cancer come back on the chest like a suit of armor? Thanks Sue
Posts.Title: suit of armor

Posts.Content: No , well it could be in the bone by now but I have stop having scans done cause it would not change the treatment and there is no sense going thru the cost of the test. Yes I had a double. Thanks for your interest, maybe someone will know. Again thanks and have a blessed day. Sue
Posts.Title: suit of armor

Posts.Content: I mean the chest is hard like a suit of armor. You can actually feel the hardest and the roughness, plus some areas are layered like a scallop bed. I know it sounds weird but that is the only way to describe it. Been taking leucovorin calcium, mitoxantrone,   5 flurorouracil and avastin every 3 weeks for 3 days in a row. The minute I stop taking them it comes back overnight. Just wanted to know if I am the only one out there. The only other case my doctor had is no longer with us. Thanks Sue
Posts.Title: suit of armor

Posts.Content: Forgot to mention that it will fester, drain, and stink. Maybe this will ring a bell with someone else that had this type of cancer. If I stop the chemos which I have been doing since 11/07 I will have less than a year. There must be some else out there who has this. Thanks Sue
Posts.Title: suit of armor

Posts.Content: Hello   Anyone trie doxil and avastin?
Posts.Title: doxil

Posts.Content: Been there and done it. I had a double mastectomy and  reconstruction had my cancer was only in one. Did not want to do it again either. I was triple negative but when my cancer came back in the tissue of my skin the Her2 changed to 3+. The taxol was the worst of all chemos.  After ac/t for the first BC. The chemo that just started working is gemzar and herceptin with no side effects other than thinning hair. Tried xeloda, avastin, navelbine before this combination. I can understand not wanting to take a chance with the other breast and your doctor should understand plus you have had a second opinion I hope, if not please do. I got 3. I did not want radiation and I am not sure if it would of stopped it from coming back as fast as it did. Started 10/6/2006 and it came back aroung 5-2007. Not sorry I had a double but would of skipped the reconstruction. Had expanders and they shifted and to this day I have pain. Hope this helps some. God Bless Sue
Posts.Title: Stage IV liver mets, HER2+, ER/PR -, facing surgery post chemo

Posts.Content: My breast cancer came back as metastatic poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma of the dermis and subcutis. Only other person that had this at my doctors office is no longer alive so they have no one I can talk to about this type. If it wasn't for the cancer being on the outside you would never know I had cancer. Started with infiltrating lobular carcinoma left breast and left axillary lymph node. Had surgery and reconstruction. Plus adriamycin/cytoxan and taxol. With the new I have had xeloda, avastin, herceptin, navelbine, and now on second treatment of gemzar and herceptin. This last one seems to be slowing it down. But it is also the last IV one to try. Need to know how to treat the open ulcerations and drainage that is in my future and any other goodies I know nothing about. Please let me know if I am not the only one with this type. God Bless   Sue
Posts.Title: looking for same kind adenocarcinoma

Posts.Content: I lost my hair with adriamycin cytoxan and taxol Did not with xeloda, avastin, herceptin, navelbine, gemzar, tykerb. Even though I am triple negative they tried some for her2 positive just incase some thing might work.   Now on avastin, levcovorin calcium, mitoxantrone, 5-fluorouracil and my hair is thinning but I have only had one  round. Next 3 days are 17/18/19. I also do no want to lose my hair because I also lose my strenght and I need to continue to work so I will have insurance!!!!!
Posts.Title: Oncotype dx testing and decisions made

Posts.Content: Yes I found lots on the lobular and other types of BC but can find no pictures or side effects for adenocarcinoma. Everything  I find just tells me it is in the tissue. Even the doctors have nothing. I think I will visit the dermatologist and see what they say. God Bless Sue
Posts.Title: looking for same kind adenocarcinoma

Posts.Content: Hi.....I do not have your type of BC but I have my second port. The first was taken out because I was cured and when it came back I had the port put back in and have never had a problem with it. The chemo goes in faster and your veins are saved cause they even take your blood samples from your port. Taxol was not very nice to me. Get some B+ and take that to help with the neuropathy. Also use utter cream on your feet and hands day and night. Also try to never own your cancer. Smile as often as you can and laugh.............it is the only way.......you can do it. God Bless Sue
Posts.Title: Taxol

Posts.Content: Thanks for responding. I started on 10-06-06 with BC at IIIA stage. Was also triple negative and then when it started over again it changed to her2/neu 3+. We had every thing retested to make sure there was not an error . Now they think it might of changed back to negative because the herceptin isn't working. I just can't find anything helpful on the internet about this type. Again thanks and my prayers are with you. Sue
Posts.Title: looking for same kind adenocarcinoma

Posts.Content: Hi.I am 5'4 and 115 pounds. Was a c cup before cancer. My implants are 250 which is nearly a b cup and plenty big enough.  Just make sure before they put the implants in that they mark you in the right place. My expanders had shifted  (which they already knew) and they put them in the wrong spot and I had to redoe the surgery. It has been over a year now the pain from sewing up the pocket still hurts. They said it will hurt atleast 2 years. Best of luck. Sue
Posts.Title: tissue expanders

Posts.Content: Hi. One of my expanders shifted during reconstruction and when the implants were put in, the doctor put it in the wrong place. When he came in for the follow-up visit he said "that's not where I wanted them, come back in 6 weeks and we will have a redo". I had it corrected in two weeks cause I had to get back to work. My chemo was before the surgery because the oncologist said that is how she would be able to judge if the treatments were working to see the tumor shrink.  Find out what type of expander you have and check it out on the web. There is more than one out there. Just ask lots of questions please. Hang in there. Sue
Posts.Title: deflated expander!!

Posts.Content: Has any one tried xeloda with tykerb? That is my next treatment if I continue. Any feedback is helpful. Thanks
Posts.Title: tykerb
